title: Chicago Title serif font
content:
Please ID the font used on this Chicago Title lettering. Thank you.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [CHICAGO TITLE.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120627030903/http:/typophile.com/files/CHICAGO%20TITLE.jpg) | 52.29 KB |
author: evan

comments.content: In the Baskerville family, not sure which though.
The serifs are more pronounced on all the Baskervilles I've looked at. Any other thoughts?

It isn't Goudy -

Evan, can you give us the source of your sample?

a scan from a business card. I looked at the website and it is nothing like the Chicago Title logo type. Maybe it was typeset by some quick printer using some "free" font or knock-off. I did not recognize it and thought maybe someone else has seen it before.
The engraving process might also have softened the serifs.
Despite not having the spurs on the T, I think it looks like some flavor of Garamond.
